attributes.action: use all his considerable political and personal influence to persuade parliament to ban the use of the honorifics “honourable” and “right honourable” by members of parliament when they address each other in the House of Commons.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The recent political scandal caused by the disclosure and their reaction to such disclosure of widespread misuse of MP’s allowances and expenses, has brought disgrace and shame to this country.  The damage done by the loss of confidence in the political system of the UK will probably never be overcome and the fact that this parliament will forever more be known as the “Rotten Parliament” is well deserved.  
It is clear that the behaviour of the majority of the House members, disqualifies them from being referred to as an “honourable” member or a “right honourable” member.
It is requested that the Prime Minister reinforces his disgust in the behaviour of such members from all political parties in the House of Commons, by doing everything in his power to ban the use of these now inappropriate terms within the House of Commons.
This ban, if enforced, would ensure that this “Rotten Parliament”, elected in 2005, would never be forgotten and hopefully prevent such a repetition of this shameful  obnoxious corruption occurring again.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
